quote: The only constant in the technology industry is change.
author: Marc Beniof

quote: The 4 Ps for Change and Release: Planning Prevents Poor Performance.
author: Unknown

quote: Any sufficiently advanced bug is indistinguishable from a feature.
author: Rick Kulaweic

quote: IT is ever-changing and there is the need to evolve in order to stay relevant.
author: Ryan Ogilvie

quote: A Release is like a boat. 80% of the holes plugged is not good enough.
author: Unknown

quote: Try harder next time…is not a problem management method mentioned in ITIL.
author: Denis Matte

quote: Technology itself is neither good or bad. People are good or bad.
author: Naveen Jain

quote: ITSM delivery is all about helping people and that’s why it’s important to keep the human touch intact.
author: Unknown

quote: Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.
author: Leonardo DaVinci

quote: IT is not just another department in an organization. It’s pervasive, like electricity.
author: The Phoenix Project

quote: The Change manager is like the air traffic controller of the production environment.
author: Unknown

quote: A fool with a tool is still a fool. Always have a goal, a plan & the tool as the enabler.
author: Darshan Appayanna

quote: The best customer service is when end users don’t need to reach out to the help desk.
author: Nishant Rao

quote: The SLA explains the service. It does not predict the performance of that service. Explanation does not mean prediction.
author: Denis Matte

quote: The simplest way to increase availability is to focus on Incident Management and Change Management.
author: Unknown

quote: Quality in a service or product is not what you put into it. It’s what the client or customer gets out of it.
author: Peter Drucker

quote: The foundation of good help desk support is the ability to organize your workload, prioritize tickets, and monitor ticket management.
author: Megan Pacella

quote: The value of networking. It is very important (in IT). There are so many resources out there that you can connect with for the latest updates, tips and tricks.
author: Ryan Ogilvie

quote: IT Security is a form of Problem Management. It looks to proactively prevent Incidents.
author: Unknown

quote: Getting information off the Internet is like taking a drink from a fire hydrant.
author: Mitchell Kapor

quote: When working for IT Security, you are only one Incident away from being the most important group in IT.
author: Unknown

quote: If people resist Root Cause Analysis, ask what they will do to prevent it in the future.
author: Denis Matte

quote: Not all improvement ideas are good ones. Process and governance is needed to allow bad ideas to die and good ideas to flourish.
author: Denis Matte

quote: If you want a 2-3% efficiency improvement in IT service management, work harder. If you want a 30-50% efficiency improvement, adopt Lean.
author: Stuart Rance

quote: Any improvements made anywhere except the bottleneck are an illusion.
author: The Phoenix Project

quote: ITSM is full of verschlimmbesserung – supposed improvements that make things worse. Correct this by adopting better change management principles and aligning all initiatives to a shared goal – exceptional customer experience.
author: Stuart Rance

quote: In our company, we all have 2 jobs: 1) to do our job and 2) to improve it
author: Toyota

quote: It is better to have a frustrated person who complains than someone who no longer cares about the system in place.
author: Ryan Ogilvie
Notepad++
quote: The creation of Notepad++ is due to my need for a decent editor to edit the source code of Notepad++

author: Notepad++ #1
quote:
I hate reading other people's code.

quote:
Good programmers use Notepad++ to code.

quote:
The best things in life are free.
Notepad++ is free.
So Notepad++ is the best.

author: Seymour Cray
quote: The trouble with programmers is that you can never tell what a programmer is doing until it's too late.

quote: Debugging is twice as hard as writing the code in the first place. Therefore, if you write the code as cleverly as possible, you are, by definition, not smart enough to debug it.

quote: Most software today is very much like an Egyptian pyramid with millions of bricks piled on top of each other, with no structural integrity, but just done by brute force and thousands of slaves.

author: Anonymous #81
quote:
A male engineering student was crossing a road one day when a frog called out to him and said, "If you kiss me, I'll turn into a beautiful princess." He bent over, picked up the frog, and put it in his pocket.

The frog spoke up again and said, "If you kiss me and turn me back into a beautiful princess, I will stay with you for one week." The engineering student took the frog out of his pocket, smiled at it; and returned it to his pocket.

The frog then cried out, "If you kiss me and turn me back into a princess, I'll stay with you and do ANYTHING you want." Again the boy took the frog out, smiled at it, and put it back into his pocket.

Finally, the frog asked, "What is the matter? I've told you I'm a beautiful princess, that I'll stay with you for a week and do anything you want. Why won't you kiss me?" The boy said, "Look I'm an engineer. I don't have time for a girlfriend, but a talking frog is cool."

author: Dennis Ritchie
quote:
Empty your memory, with a free(), like a pointer.
If you cast a pointer to a integer, it becomes the integer.
If you cast a pointer to a struct, it becomes the struct.
The pointer can crash, and can overflow.
Be a pointer my friend.

author: Francis bacon
quote:
Knowledge is power. France is bacon.

When I was young my father said to me: "Knowledge is power, Francis Bacon." I understood it as "Knowledge is power, France is bacon."

For more than a decade I wondered over the meaning of the second part and what was the surreal linkage between the two. If I said the quote to someone, "Knowledge is power, France is Bacon", they nodded knowingly. Or someone might say, "Knowledge is power" and I'd finish the quote "France is Bacon" and they wouldn't look at me like I'd said something very odd, but thoughtfully agree. I did ask a teacher what did "Knowledge is power, France is bacon" mean and got a full 10-minute explanation of the "knowledge is power" bit but nothing on "France is bacon". When I prompted further explanation by saying "France is bacon?" in a questioning tone I just got a "yes". At 12 I didn't have the confidence to press it further. I just accepted it as something I'd never understand.

It wasn't until years later I saw it written down that the penny dropped.

author: #JeSuisCharlie
quote:
Freedom of expression is like the air we breathe, we don't feel it, until people take it away from us.

For this reason, Je suis Charlie, not because I endorse everything they published, but because I cherish the right to speak out freely without risk even when it offends others.
And no, you cannot just take someone's life for whatever he/she expressed.

Hence this "Je suis Charlie" edition.
